de.halirutan.mathematica.codeInsight
Class MathematicaQuoteHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions.SimpleTokenSetQuoteHandler
      de.halirutan.mathematica.codeInsight.MathematicaQuoteHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions.QuoteHandler
public class MathematicaQuoteHandler
extends com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions.SimpleTokenSetQuoteHandler

Provides the intelligent insertion of quotes. This, like the MathematicaBraceMatcher works on the lexer token too. I should note, a string like "blub" is returned by the lexer as the sequence STRING_LITERAL_BEGIN, STRING_LITERAL, STRING_LITERAL_END.

Author:
patrick (4/8/13)

isClosingQuote

public boolean isClosingQuote(com.intellij.openapi.editor.highlighter.HighlighterIterator iterator,
                              int offset)
Should return true if the current offset is the closing quote of the string. Unfortunately, I'm not quite sure anymore why I had to make the calculations but I remember that something with the removal of an empty string did not work.

Specified by:
isClosingQuote in interface com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions.QuoteHandler
Overrides:
isClosingQuote in class com.intellij.codeInsight.editorActions.SimpleTokenSetQuoteHandler
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator to move through the token stream. Here, only used to get the current token type
offset - current character offset
Returns:
true, if the current offset is a closing quote

isOpeningQuote

public boolean isOpeningQuote(com.intellij.openapi.editor.highlighter.HighlighterIterator iterator,
                              int offset)
Finds out whether the current offset is an opening quote element.
